attributes.action: ban the live import and export of animals for slaughter
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Animals are exported from the UK to be slaughtered on the continent where welfare standards are, well, different from ours.  Equines from the UK are exported alive to be killed and eaten by our continental neighbours who don't make the same distinction as we do between companion animals and food-stuffs.

Animals are imported into the UK for slaughter so that their meat may be labelled as British. 

The transportation of animals does not benefit their welfare.  The labelling of imported animals as British is misleading to consumers.  All this transportation emits harmful CO2 gas.  And there's always the risk that animal diseases may be transmitted this was (case in point - bird 'flu).

So please consider signing my petiton to call for a ban.
